post_text: The Ray High Chemistry class, Juniors, have been studying concepts and facts about gas and “gas laws.” During several of the labs one of the studies involved the study of hot gases and the volume of hot gases and the properties of hot gases. This “Hot Air Balloon” lab used the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) Process to create the “homemade” hot air balloons. Students first made prototypes, due to the complexity of handling the tissue paper for the final project. After students understood how to make the balloons, the final projects were made of tissue paper, the type that is used in gift bags. A wire ballast holding a cotton ball was installed, the cotton ball was soaked with rubbing alcohol, then ignited. The burning cotton ball provided the hot air to allow the balloon to take to the skies. Balloons attained an estimated altitude of 500 feet before they fell back to Earth. It was exciting for the students to watch their engineered project take flight. Science is always fun when it works….!

post_text: The High School Junior ICS (Integrated Community Science) Class recently hosted a “Mini-science” Fair for the Ray Primary 2nd Graders. The general theme of the science fair was “Newton’s Laws of Motion.” Students in the ICS Class researched many Newtonian concepts and projects and adapted the research to create an in class “fair exhibit.” There were 19 individualized projects, and most were successful during the fair. Often times the best planned science may not cooperate and function, but that’s what makes “science” what it is, more experimentation. The ICS Class studies many disciplines, “Newton’s Laws” is Physics concept, other areas studied by this class include, Chemistry, Geology, Math, and Physics. Students are very involved with many “hands-on” projects and experiments throughout the school year.

8th Grade Girls Repeat as CJHL Basketball Champions, Finish Season 9-1...

On Saturday, January 28th, the Ray Jr. High 8th grade girls basketball team won back-to-back Central Junior High League Girls Basketball Championships by defeating High Desert Middle School 41-36 in the championship game. The Ladycat's entered the tournament as the #2 seed and defeated #3 seed, Hayden Jr. High School, 34-29.

The 7th grade girls basketball team entered the tournament as the #6 seed, and upset #3 seed, Hayden Jr. High School, 21-16 in the quarter-finals. In their semi-final match they fell to the #2 seed, High Desert Middle School 24-9.

The 7th grade boys basketball team entered the tournament as the #4 seed, and defeated the #5 seed, Eloy Jr. High School 34-30. In their semi-final match they fell to #1 seed, Miami Jr. High School 35-17.

The 8th grade boys basketball team entered the tournament as the #3 seed, and defeated the #6 seed, Eloy Jr. High School 53-44. In their semi-final match they fell to the #2 seed, Superior Jr. High School 31-20.

We are so proud of our Bearcats!
